info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:06PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 506 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Schnebly Hill Overlook, or 9 miles northeast of Sedona, moving northeast at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Sedona, Munds Park, Schnebly Hill Overlook, Pine Flats, Slide Rock State Park, Oak Creek Vista Overlook, Mountainaire, Mormon Mountain, Kachina Village, Forest Highlands, Munds Mountain Wilderness, Indian Gardens, West Fork of Oak Creek, and Red Rock-Secret Mountain Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 316 and 334. State Route 89A between mile markers 375 and 387.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Manzanita Campground, Pine Flat Campground, Cave Springs Campground and Pine Flat Campground.
This includes the following swimming holes... Pumphouse Wash, Slide Rock, Encinoso, Grasshopper Point and Midgely Bridge.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT ALONG INTERSTATE 17 BETWEEN KACHINA VILLAGE AND MUNDS PARK UNTIL 530 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
